p: Due to negative perceptions of synthetic preservatives among consumers, the interest in essential oils focusing on their application in food preservation has grown considerably in the last few years [ 1]. Essential oils added to edible products, either by direct mixing or in edible coatings and active packaging may stand as a valid alternative to prolong shelf-life and prevent autoxidation [ 15]. For this purpose, the food industry requires large amounts of essential oils. Vegetable raw materials (mainly leaves) used for large-scale extraction of essential oils are usually purchased from different suppliers. In their dry state they are more stable during storage and are therefore available throughout the year.
